text.strong: ‌How many years did you study <English²> in school?‌

text.em: ‌(Including years at the <ISCED 1 level>, <ISCED 2 level> and <ISCED 3 level>; but not the years at <ISCED 4-8 level>.)‌

label.text: I did not study <English²> in school
1 year or less
From 2 to 5 years
From 6 to 10 years
More than 10 years

text.strong: ‌Have you learnt <English²> outside of <primary and secondary education> in the following ways?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: At an <adult education centre>
At a tertiary education institution (e.g. <university; add country-specific examples>)
Through private tutoring
By using <English²> in my daily life (for example conversations, watching movies)
By staying abroad

text.strong: ‌How often do you come into contact with <English²> in the following ways?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Communicating with people in the area where I live (e.g. friends, relatives, acquaintances)
Communicating with people living far away (e.g. friends, relatives, acquaintances)
Communicating with tourists who visit the place where I live
Communicating with colleagues
Communicating while travelling
Through spoken media (e.g. television, movies, radio)
Through written media (e.g. books, websites, social media)
Through self-instruction (e.g. learning applications, online courses)

text.strong: ‌How often do you or someone else living in your home do the following things with your child?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Help my child with <English¹> homework
Listen to songs in <English²> with my child
Watch movies, programmes or online videos in <English²> with my child (e.g. on television, online streaming services, <YouTube®>)
Play video games in <English²> with my child
Talk to my child in <English²>
Help my child prepare for <English¹> school tests
Suggest some books for my child to read in <English²>
Watch something in <English²> on a screen (with or without subtitles) together with my child

text.strong: ‌How often has your child participated in the following activities in the past five years?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: A school trip to a non-<PISA reading test language> speaking country
An organised visit to schools or families in a non-<PISA reading test language> speaking country
A family trip to a non-<PISA reading test language> speaking country
A trip to visit your family in a non-<PISA reading test language> speaking country

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: My child’s <English¹> school teacher is responsive to students’ needs.
My child’s <English¹> school teacher is dedicated.
I am satisfied with how <English¹> is taught at my child’s school.
My child’s school is effective in helping my child make progress in <English²>.
My child’s progress in <English¹> lessons is carefully monitored by the school.
I am satisfied with the amount of time my child spends learning <English¹> at school.
My child’s <English¹> school teacher pays attention to my child’s progress.
I am satisfied with the quality of <English¹> lessons my child receives at school.

text.strong: ‌In your opinion, how important is <English²> for your child, for the following purposes?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: For travelling
For getting a good job
For further education
For entertainment (e.g. games, movies, music)
For using computers and other technical devices
For personal development (e.g. courses for personal interest, reading for knowledge or pleasure)
For communicating with people from different cultures

text.strong: ‌To what extent can (or could) you do the following things when speaking <English²>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Give basic personal information (e.g. address, nationality).
Give a short description of very familiar topics (e.g. yourself, your family).
Give a description of everyday topics (e.g. your hobbies, your work).
Give a description of events and personal experiences (e.g. about your plans, a trip you took).
Give an opinion on a current issue (e.g. on climate change, use of technology).
Summarise ideas about a complex subject (e.g. in an oral summary or presentation)
Briefly give reasons and explanations for opinions and plans

text.strong: ‌To what extent can (or could) you do the following things when reading in <English²>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Understand words commonly used in everyday life (e.g. common street signs, posters, menus).
Understand words and phrases in very short simple texts (e.g. flyers, postcards).
Understand short simple texts with predictable information and on familiar subjects (e.g. invitations, basic instructions).
Understand the main points in texts describing events and feelings (e.g. short news articles, personal emails).
Understand longer texts in which the writers express their points of view (e.g. news articles, reports).
Understand detailed information in longer and more complex texts related to your personal interests (e.g. books, subject specific articles).

text.strong: ‌How often did you do the following things at work during the last twelve months?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
‌Never/ I have not worked during the last 12 months‌

label.text: Speak <English²> (e.g. giving presentations, participating in conversations).
Write in <English²> (e.g. writing emails, drafting reports).
Listen to spoken <English²> (e.g. videos, presentations, conversations).
Read in <English²> (e.g. reading emails or technical documents).
